intro: Gomphrena paniculata var. pilosiuscula, commonly known as the hairy gomphrena, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, spiky, pink to reddish-purple flowers. The leaves are typically hairy and covered in fine, soft pubescence, giving the plant its common name. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. The plant is known for its long bloom period, adding color to gardens from late summer into autumn.
